title: I Hired a contract killer. The Match factory girl
creator_credit: Villealfa Filmproductions, Swedish Film Institute and Aki Kaurismaki
brief_description: Aki Kaurismaki’s films have been described as “Ealing comedies on downers” (Timeout). Presented here are two features from the director, producer, writer and editor. Kaurismaki’s films capture a deadpan humour framed within a melancholic society where the protagonists, as if frozen, become still lives perfectly matched to the poverty of their environment (captured by the superb cinematography of Timo Salminen). Set in London (and in the English language), “I Hired a contract killer” is a slow meditation on loneliness and isolation within a dehumanised industrial setting. After fifteen years of loyal service to his company, Henri Boulanger (Jean-Pierre Leaud), a lone migrant, is fired on the spot. In his despair he hires a contract killer after several unsuccessful attempts at suicide. But best laid plans can go wrong…almost immediately after arranging the contract, Henri’s faith in humanity is restored when he falls in love with Margaret (Margi Clarke), another loner. Henri is now in a race against time as he endeavors to have his contract cancelled. (Cast includes: Joe Strummer, Serge Reggiani). “The Match factory girl” (in Swedish language with English subtitles) is the modern Cinderella tale without the Hollywood ending. Iris (Kati Outinen) works in a factory supporting her cruel mother and stepfather. Her dreams of escaping the life are shattered when ‘love’ turns out to be another part of the misery. Numbed by the present and burdened by her past, Iris’s rage catapults her into the future.
